intro: Pilosella callimorphoides, commonly known as the slender mountain fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate, while its flowers are small and yellowish, often arranged in a cluster. Pilosella callimorphoides is often found in open areas with poor soil, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
